Function Documentation

TestCase_C0001_openTrustlet ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
mcOpenTrustlet
Test Steps:
Test case allocate memory for trusted application blob, reads trusted application into it from file and calls mcOpenTrustlet() with correct parameter. It verifies that call is successful.
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
Yes
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
Yes
Quick Testcase:
No
Test ID:
Normal_Client_API.01300_mcOpenTrustlet.C0001_openTrustlet
TestCase_C0002_openTrustletPartial ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
mcOpenTrustlet
Test Steps:
Test case allocate memory for trusted application blob, partially reads trusted application into it from file and calls mcOpenTrustlet() with correct parameter. It verifies that call fails.
Manual Execution:

TestCase_C0003_openTrustletExtraPadded ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
mcOpenTrustlet
Test Steps:
Test case allocate more memory then needed for trusted application blob, reads trusted application into it from file and calls mcOpenTrustlet() with correct parameter. It verifies that call fails.
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
Yes

TestCase_C0004_TrustletNullSession ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
mcOpenTrustlet with a null sessionHandle returns MC_DRV_ERR_INVALID_PARAMETER.
Test Steps:
TLC opens a trustlet with NULL pointer parameter for session. mcOpenTrustlet() returns MC_DRV_ERR_INVALID_PARAMETER.
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
Yes
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
Yes
Quick Testcase:
No
Test ID:
Normal_Client_API.01300_mcOpenTrustlet.C0004_TrustletNullSession
TestCase_C0005_nullTciAndSomeLengthOrSomeTciAndNullLength ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
mcOpenTrustlet with not correponding tci information retruns MC_DRV_ERR_INVALID_PARAMETER.
Test Steps:
TLC opens a trustlet with a TCI and its length which do not make sense Here : both (tci=NULL && tciLen!=0) and (tci!=NULL && tciLen=0) are tested. mcOpenTrustlet() returns MC_DRV_ERR_INVALID_PARAMETER
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
Yes
Extensive Testcase:
Yes
Basic Testcase:
Yes
Quick Testcase:
No
Test ID:
Normal_Client_API.01300_mcOpenTrustlet.C0005_nullTciAndSomeLengthOrSomeTciAndNullLength

TestCase_C0007_TrustletTooBigTci ( )
Trusted Applications dependencies:
none
Focus:
mcOpenTrustlet with tci not fitting the API limits returns MC_DRV_ERR_INVALID_PARAMETER.
Test Steps:
TLC opens a trustlet with a TCI with a length > MC_MAX_TCI_LEN. mcOpenTrustlet() returns MC_DRV_ERR_INVALID_PARAMETER
Manual Execution:
No
Trustonic Test Suite Testcase:
Yes
Final Device Testcase:
Yes
